title: Web 2.0-Based Hybrid Chemistry Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemistry concepts and proficiency in fundamental digital tools
context.additional_context: Flexible Learning Schedules and Workplace-Integrated Case Studies Designed for Office/Administrative Professionals

learning_goals: Produce three or more types of digital content explaining chemistry concepts using Web 2.0 tools (blogs, wikis, collaboration platforms).
Write two analytical reports on chemistry experiment results through online-offline collaborative activities in a hybrid learning model.
Derive five or more chemistry problem-solving strategies by applying Kolb’s Experiential Learning Cycle (Concrete Experience–Reflective Observation–Abstract Conceptualization–Active Experimentation).

resources: Digital collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
